The other day I was wanting to build an asteroid base. I was thinking that a regular, dull gray asteroid would be to boring. It would be best to find a MAGIC ASTEROID!

But, I could not find anything, anywhere that could tell me if any asteroid was magic!

So I had to alt-f12 kerbals to each asteroid to see if any where magic.

Is there a better way to seek out these rare and elusive behemoths?

My understanding is that asteroids aren't generated until you enter physics range, i.e., about 2.2 km. So you can save just before encountering an asteroid and reload until you get a magic version. I believe the occurrence rate is about 1 in 20.

You could find one such asteroid, then compare it in the persistent file to other asteroids to see if there's something in there that denotes such an asteroid as magical.

There is no way I know of though to determine it beforehand.

@Grogs and @Superfluous J both are good ideas....yet still masochistic!

*cracks knuckles* time to do some good ‘ol save file hacking....

If I remember correctly, the code for making it magic is hiding in a shader, and it's "random" based on some attribute of the PotatoRoid part (maybe the uid)?  So if I was going to go save file hacking, I would try adding one to that value until it becomes magic.
